title: How to Get Bumble Premium for Free: Free Trial Setup & More

steps.title: Open Bumble.
steps.content: Open Bumble. This app icon looks like a beehive on a yellow background. If you're using a computer, you can go to https://bumble.com . Free trials are usually only available to brand new accounts. If you already have an account and skipped the trial, you'll have to wait until Bumble is offering a trial period to existing users who've never used a trial before. When such an offer is available to you, you'll be notified in the app or on the web.

steps.title: Click or tap Join.
steps.content: Click or tap Join . You can choose a login method, such as your Facebook account or cell phone number to create your account. [1] X Research source If you choose to use your phone number, you'll get a code sent via SMS that you'll need to enter into the app to continue.

steps.title: Create your password
steps.content: Create your password (if prompted). You may not be prompted to enter a password if you're using a phone or tablet. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Upload pictures of yourself and create your profile.
steps.content: Upload pictures of yourself and create your profile . You'll need to add pictures that follow Bumble's guidelines so they don't get moderated. Use your best photos and fill out your profile thoroughly. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Accept the free Bumble Premium trial.
steps.content: Accept the free Bumble Premium trial. If you're not offered a free trial before you're shown your first match, try closing and re-opening Bumble. Some users report that it can take a few days before an offer for a free trial will appear. As long as you cancel your subscription before the trial period ends, you will not be billed for Bumble Premium. [4] X Research source Note that you will not be charged unless you decide to continue with Bumble Premium. If you decide that you want to continue with Bumble Premium, you can cancel at any time. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Bumble's free tier has many features.
steps.content: Bumble's free tier has many features. You can make matches , send messages, use basic filters, and swipe through profiles , and even extend one match per day without paying a dime. [6] X Research source Sticking to Bumble's free tier doesn't mean you won't find love!

steps.title: Bumble Premium can give you profile more exposure.
steps.content: Bumble Premium can give you profile more exposure. Spotlight is a Premium feature that moves your profile to the top of the stack, making you more visible to other members. [7] X Research source With Premium, you'll get one Spotlight per weekâ€”there are no recurring Spotlights with the free tier. Even with the free tier, you can purchase Spotlight placement as a standalone feature each time you want to use it. This allows you to use Spotlight when you want to, without the need for a recurring membership.

steps.title: A Premium subscription lets you see who likes you.
steps.content: A Premium subscription lets you see who likes you. With a free account, you can't see your Beeline , as the user photos will be blurred out. If you want to see who already liked you before you swipe, Premium will be a good upgrade for you. [8] X Research source If you want access to more SuperSwipes , Spotlight, extended time to respond to matches, rematches,

steps.title: Premium's Advanced Filters are helpful for densely-populated areas.
steps.content: Premium's Advanced Filters are helpful for densely-populated areas. If a lot of people in your area are using Bumble, advanced filters and unlimited swipes can help you sort through the massive amounts of potential matches to find the people you'll really like. [9] X Research source

steps.title: The Travel Mode feature is crucial for dating long distance.
steps.content: The Travel Mode feature is crucial for dating long distance. Premium will be valuable to you if you want to date outside of your immediate area, as Travel Mode lets you match in any region. [10] X Research source
